reviews.text: This is a fantastic Marriott located literally above the Shinkansen station, making it absurdly convenient.
reviews.title: Awesome location, views, service

reviews.text: But apart from that, it's a top-notch city hotel (if a little soulless) in the centre of Nagoya. The rooms are beautiful, luxurious and have stunning views. Very 'lost in translation'. The breakfast was great and the concierge extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Nice, but...

likes.disliked: — Price to access pool (nonsense!), small room, fairly uncomfortable bed

reviews.text: Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
reviews.title: Nice and convenient stay in Nagoya

likes.liked: — Very clean and updated, location to train station.
likes.disliked: — Accomodations are really good - communication problems with the front desk were the problem.

reviews.text: Just returned from a 2-week business trip there. Overall, the hotel is really classy with a refined and beautiful decoration -marvellous Christmas ones, in particular-. My room, although nicely furnished and cosy, was particularly small, and my bed was not comfortable. Also, it was a bit noisy due to the nearby train station. Fortunately, the bathroom was brand new, very well equipped, extremely clean. Had made it clear when booking that I wanted a non-smoking room. However, it seems that they missed the point and I got a smoking one upon arrival. So I asked for a change. This process, though, took a long time. The first room I was given had almost no window -unacceptable for such a long stay- so I had to wait until the next one, fairly small as already mentioned. Not very professional for a 5-star-or-so hotel. Also, breakfast is served until 10am only, which is a bit early during week-end. And they really stop @ 10am sharp. Finally, the price of 3150JPY to access the pool is just nonsense - increadibly expensive, indeed. Restaurants are globally OK, but I recommend that you try those in the 12th & 13th floor in the building instead. All in all, I was a bit disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location & Classy

likes.liked: — Centrally located, still feels brand new, great views

reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott Associa Nagoya for 2 nights of a 10-day China and Japan business trip with my boyfriend...I tagged along.
reviews.title: The perfect location

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel because it is practically connected to Nagoya train station. I paid about $250 a night for a very small room with a very nice bathroom. I was quite dissappointed to find out that the spa/fitness center has a very limited hours of operation. Since I checked in at 8:00 pm and checked out at 7:00 am, I was not able to take advantage of the fitness facility. The hotel has a very nice looking lobby, and most of the front desk staff can speak English. Since it was raining the day I traveled, it was nice to be able to get to the train station without going outside at all.
reviews.title: Great Location, but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hands down the best hotel we stayed in in Japan! 5-star hotel indeed!
reviews.title: Loved the Marriot Nagoya Associa

likes.disliked: — probably the price. but you get what you pay for.

reviews.text: The hotel is above the Nagoya train station so it is in such a great location. Imagine, right after leaving the JR shinkansen turnstile, the hotel is just a few meters away. Don't worry, the lobby is no way near the crowd (it's on the 15th floor).
reviews.title: Definitely the BEST!

reviews.text: The hotel is part of a complex whose 12th floor housed dozens of posh restaurants to choose from.
reviews.title: Luxurious with great view, but not so much modern?

reviews.text: Underneath the train station are rows of shops and restaurants. Everything was within arm's reach. I actually underestimated my stay in Nagoya. This is a good place to shop.
reviews.title: Good hotel but you could be anywhere

reviews.text: The location is fantastic. It is above Nagoya Station - JR Lines that serves intercity trains in Japan. It is very convenient to move around and to get some food or stuff. The hotel is connected with Takashimaya Department Store and the train station. Across from the hotel, there are many local food shops which I really recommend you to go to.
reviews.title: My favorite in Nagoya city!

reviews.text: The room is impeccable. It is very spacious for a hotel standard in Japan and the the room is pretty much spotless. I truly appreciate their supply of amenities board and kits. It really understands the needs of a frequent travelers. TV is huge and the view is fantastic too from the top.
reviews.title: One of my all-time favorites!

reviews.text: However, it is kind of funny when you have to pay to use the gym or pool when you stay in a hotel? With a price of a night stay in this hotel, I think it should be inclusive of any standard benefit you can get from a good hotel which is health club. Just my opinion though. They should really make it complimentary to staying guests with such price.
reviews.title: Very good hotel and should be considering the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, it is a nice stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel to any travelers.
reviews.title: Not too shabby

reviews.text: First, location is fantastic - right above the train station in the middle of town! Beautiful lobby, excellent choice of bars. Note - the newest bartenders are at the train level, experience increases as you get to higher floors. Rooms are spotless, service is impeccable. Never ate in the hotel so no feedback there. Also, the concierge is helpful but for a more local touch, use the information kiosks in the train station. The staff there are extremely helpful and offer more/less expensive options.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: We stayed in Marriot for one week first week of May 2008. BY default, when on business trip, this is our favorite choice. However, I was not impressed with this Marriot at all, perhaps it is mostly because its high price and extra "unadvertised premium" for the usage of pool.
reviews.title: Classic Decor, over bearing services and expensive premium facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it is a good busy stay because of its location.
reviews.title: Well Deserved Reputation!

likes.liked: — Huge modern room with Club access. Spa area.
likes.disliked: — Having to take 2 lifts to reach the room and to leave the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: A1. Right on top of the rail central station so you have quick and convenient access to every where.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Price: Very expensive. single $180 US and double $240 US.
reviews.title: Great hotel - Perfect Location

likes.liked: — The location. The cleanest large chain hotel room I've ever stayed in.
likes.disliked: — Guests need to pay an extra service fee to use the pool.

reviews.text: Facilities: Fitness club is compementary but pool access is $32US each time. May I say "WOW"??!!! What is misleading is that this is not communicated even on their official web site so we complainted to both HQ and local manager. Of course, they did notthing. 3 Days later, we escalted the complaint, they still did nothing. We were very disapoointed. We don't mind local rules. But they should be communicated upfront not after facts. And in an inertnational Marriott? I would have expected from Meitesu grand hotel or other local hotels, but NEVER Marriott. I urged them to update their offical website, and hopefully they have complied.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I only had one night in the Marriot and was very impressed. The room was huge and very well finished, the breakfast was exceptional and the staff very helpful. I had been staying in typical Japanese Budget hotels for the previous week and the size and luxury of the Marriot was a real treat. At the price this is awesome value for money.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I've been at the Marriott over a month and I can say the service at the Hilton is far superior. I am very disappointed having spent so many nights there. The room walls are thin, I can clearly hear my neighbors when they flush the toilet, the loud speakerphones outside, and the construction outside. They want to nickel and dime you for everything here. Sure it's convenient and close to the trains, but good service wins my vote.
reviews.title: Horrible Service and Experience

reviews.text: Staed here one night on a business trip -- really like the rooms -- not the typical ridiculously small Japanese business room. For 16000 yen a nice American-sized room. From the 30th floor, nice views. clean clean clean. The only quibble is the 3200 yen charge to use the swimming pool? That is rather mean.
reviews.title: Great place. One quibble

reviews.text: Check out the 51st floor bar at night -- the view of Nagoya castle and the city below is stunning. And they make some good drinks priced between 1000 and 1200 yen.
reviews.title: Very average - no return planned
Just above averag but probably one of best in Nagoya
reviews.text: Stayed just one night on a recent business trip to Nagoya. Admitedly the hotel could not be more conveniently located, directly above the shinkansen tracks of Nagoya Railway Station. Ride the lift to the lobby on 15 and then hope for a high floor, since I was on 31 and woke at 5am to the delightful seranade of clickety-click, clickety-click from the rail lines below.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was the most spacious we stayed in while in Japan, and beds felt luxurious. The executive lounge offered an excellent selection of canapés in the evening and a mix of Japanese and western food in the morning. Location was excellent for visiting the sights in Nagoya as it is just above the JR train station and a minute's walk from the bus station. Lots of food options in the shopping mall that's connected to it.
reviews.title: Nice executive lounge, spacious rooms just above JR Nagoya train station

reviews.text: I have not stayed in a Marriott hotel for a long time but chose to stay there this time as it is ranked no. 1 on tripadvisor. I wonder if there is a better hotel in Nagoya as although the Marriott is located in a very convenient location, but the room is just average. Bathroom can only be rated as a 3-star hotel (Japan standard) in terms of the amenities provided. Guests also need to pay to use the pool & gym! The breakfast buffet was however quite impressive with lots of selection and good quality.
reviews.title: Convenient location but that's about it

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Associa for business and were very glad not to be paying for it.
reviews.title: Location and english speaking staff the main positive attributes

reviews.text: The main attributes of this hotel are: the location, the english speaking staff, relatively pleasant rooms and a nice buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Convenient location but very busy and noisy when windy

reviews.text: This hotel is located on the upper floors of a high rise tower above the main train station. This makes it very convenient if you arrive by train (if coming from Tokyo, take the bullet train - it's excellent). Merely follow the signs for the hotel, enter the first floor mini lobby and take the elevator to the 15th floor. There are a corridors to traverse before you arrive at the main lobby to check in. The staff are very courteous and speak quite good english.
reviews.title: Luxurious Hotel above Nagoya Station

reviews.text: The rooms are large and the foyer is huge. Marble, pillars, grand pianos and fountains everywhere. Great views over a dull city. Has no Japanese feel to it at all - it's just another huge hotel one could find anywhere in the world. You can shop and eat in the underground railway passages without every having to see daylight.
reviews.title: Swish and ritzy

reviews.text: We stayed one night for the convenience. I took one star off because it had all the glitz but no heart.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Very Convenient Location

reviews.text: I agree with the reviews that this location is in the most convenient location in Nagoya. Getting around Nagoya and the rest of Japan should not be an issue. I have taken the shinkansen "bullet train" from Tokyo Station to Nagoya station on many occasions. The station is located below the hotel and a shopping center with restaurants are all located in the same building or adjacent building. Transportation is also very easy to the the airport.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, and Excellent Room and Service

reviews.text: Unless you are on business travel, I would not recommend eating at the restaurants inside of the Marriott due to the price. I would usually go to the locations below and adjacent to the hotel for a good selection and more reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I always stayed on the executive level in order to get breakfast and happy hour included. The staff was very friendly and helpful in the executive lounge. I enjoyed this hotel so much that I even stayed there on a vacation when I returned to Japan to visit family and friends.
reviews.title: excellent location just above JR station but not for tranquil seekers

reviews.text: I stayed at Marriot Nagoya at executive King room. The room was large with a lot of amenities and nice view. It is attached to the Nagoya station and very convenienet to travel in Nagoya or even in day trips to other cities.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: The conceirge is fluent in english and very helpful in accomodating your needs. The executive lounge is nice with 16 hours of bevage service and daily hot breakfast and evening free cocktails. Though lighting in the lounge can be improved, the staff is certainly humble and attentive. Would highly recommend this hotel for all business travellers.
reviews.title: Great hotel with excellent location

reviews.text: We checked into the hotel on 9th October for 1 night. The hotel is conveniently located at Nagoya Station complex and it about a 5 min walk from the Shinkansen (bullet train) platform. Nagoya station is also the hub for trains operating around the nagoya area which makes the hotel a good starting point for any touring or sightseeing.
reviews.title: Was the decor French Empire?

likes.disliked: — The Japanese don't seem to believe in air conditioning in common areas....

reviews.text: The staff at the reception were efficient although not friendly. we booked a standard twin room during our stay. the room is much larger than the typical room in japan and the bathroom is twice the size an average japanese hotel bathroom. it had both a shower and bathtub. the bed was also comfortable. after staying in cramped hotel rooms for so many night, this was a welcomed change.
reviews.title: Good location but disappointing service
Very Nice
reviews.text: the concierge staff were also helpful and had good command of the english language. they were able to recommend restaurants to have dinner at.
